steps.title: Wash your face
steps.content: Wash your face using lukewarm water and a cleanser. Get a cleanser that works best for your skin type, create a lather with warm water, and massage it into your face by using your fingertips in a circular motion. [2] X Expert Source Devorah Kuperland Makeup Artist & Stylist Expert Interview. 16 April 2020. Rinse your face off and then pat it dry with a clean washcloth. Use a cream-based cleanser if you have dry skin. Use an oil-based pH-balanced gentle cleanser if you have normal skin. Use a foaming cleanser if you have oily skin. [3] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Apply a good moisturizer with sunscreen.
steps.content: Apply a good moisturizer with sunscreen. After you’ve washed your face, it’s time to hydrate and protect your skin. Massage in a quality moisturizer with an SPF and apply eye cream. [4] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source To make sure your face is being protected by the sun, get a moisturizer that protects against UVA rays. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Apply concealer
steps.content: Apply concealer . It’s crucial that you create an even base before applying your bronzer, and that starts with concealer. Choose a concealer that blends in well with your complexion. Apply it above foundation to the areas that need extra coverage. [6] X Expert Source Devorah Kuperland Makeup Artist & Stylist Expert Interview. 16 April 2020.

steps.title: Create an even canvas with liquid foundation.
steps.content: Create an even canvas with liquid foundation. Once you’ve put on concealer, apply an even coat of liquid foundation over the entirety of your face. This will smooth out your complexion and create a blank canvas for your contouring. [7] X Research source You can put your foundation on with a makeup sponge, a makeup brush, or by using your fingertips. Be sure to blend the foundation down your neck slightly for a more natural look. If you want a more subtle, natural, or softer look, consider a tinted moisturizer. Apply it the same way as a liquid foundation. If you decide to use blush, don’t apply it until after you apply your bronzer.

steps.title: Select a bronzer 1 or 2 shades darker than your natural skin tone.
steps.content: Select a bronzer 1 or 2 shades darker than your natural skin tone. Since the purpose of a bronzer is to darken the complexion subtly, the one you choose will depend on the color of your skin. Generally, it should only be 1 or 2 shades darker than your natural skin tone. Test a little on your wrist to make sure it "warms" your skin tone without making it look fake. If you have fair skin, look for a honey-colored bronzer. For a medium complexion, choose a rose-bronze or gold flecked bronzer. Dark skin is best enhanced with a tawny or amber bronzer.

steps.title: Use a wide, fluffy powder brush with a rounded top.
steps.content: Use a wide, fluffy powder brush with a rounded top. If your brush is too small or stiff, it may cause blotches and streaks to form when you apply the bronzer. There are specialized bronzer brushes available on the market, although any large blush or foundation brush will work equally as well. For a softer, more natural look, use a fan brush instead.

steps.title: Swirl the brush evenly in the bronzer.
steps.content: Swirl the brush evenly in the bronzer. It is best to apply your bronzer in light, even coats to build up color rather than adding a single dark layer at once. Therefore, just lightly coat the end of your brush in the powder and tap off the excess onto the lid of the container. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Apply the bronzer to your forehead.
steps.content: Apply the bronzer to your forehead. Your bronzer should be applied in the shape of a “3” from the top to the bottom of your face on both sides, starting with your forehead. Lightly sweep the brush along the outer sides of your upper forehead and along your hairline. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Apply the bronzer to your cheekbones.
steps.content: Apply the bronzer to your cheekbones. Next, make a fish face and apply your bronzer to your cheekbones. You can also do this by smiling, starting at the apples of your cheeks, and sweeping slightly up toward your hairline. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Apply the bronzer to your jawline.
steps.content: Apply the bronzer to your jawline. Finally, complete the “3” shape by sweeping your bronzer along your jawline. This will add definition to your face. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Brush lightly over your chin, nose and neck.
steps.content: Brush lightly over your chin, nose and neck. As you’re applying bronzer, you’ll want to focus on covering the areas of your face that sunlight tends to hit. Do a final dusting of your bronzer on the higher points of your face, such as the bridge of your nose and the tip of your chin. Complete the natural glow by applying bronzer to your neck so that it matches the coloring of your face. [12] X Research source Don't add too much bronzer, however, as this may create a heavy look.

steps.title: Use a new brush to blend the bronzer.
steps.content: Use a new brush to blend the bronzer. Take out another fluffy, clean brush and softly blend everything in so there aren’t any unnatural lines or blotches. It’s especially important that you blend the neck area. [13] X Research source To blend most effectively, start in the center and work the brush outward in small, circular motions.

steps.title: Eliminate any harsh lines with a translucent powder.
steps.content: Eliminate any harsh lines with a translucent powder. If you’ve blended and your complexion still doesn’t look smooth and subtle in color transition, swirl your blending brush in a translucent powder, tap off the excess, and blend again. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Add blush
steps.content: Add blush if desired for a brighter glow. [15] X Expert Source Devorah Kuperland Makeup Artist & Stylist Expert Interview. 16 April 2020. You can use a blush stick, liquid blush, or a powder. Apply the blush in the center of the apples of your cheeks. Blend it out towards the edges of your face with a rounded brush. steps.title: Lock in the look with a setting spray.
steps.content: Lock in the look with a setting spray. After you’re done, make sure to spray your entire face with a makeup setting spray to keep your face looking radiant all day. [17] X Research source
